RevText.raw: Raw black-cherry aromas are direct and simple but good. This has a juicy feel that thickens over time, with oak character and extract becoming more apparent. A flavor profile driven by dark-berry fruits and smoldering oak finishes meaty but hot.
RevText.processed: raw black cherry aroma direct simple good juicy feel thicken time oak character extract apparent flavor profile drive dark berry fruit smolder oak finish meaty hot

RevText.raw: A sleek mix of tart berry, stem and herb, along with a hint of oak and chocolate, this is a fair value in a widely available, drink-now Oregon Pinot. The wine oak-aged for six months, whether in neutral or re-staved is not indicated.
RevText.processed: sleek mix tart berry stem herb hint oak chocolate fair value widely available drink oregon pinot wine oak aged month neutral stave indicate

RevText.raw: This is dominated by oak and oak-driven aromas that include roasted coffee bean, espresso, coconut and vanilla that carry over to the palate, together with plum and chocolate. Astringent, drying tannins give it a rather abrupt finish.
RevText.processed: dominate oak oak drive aroma include roasted coffee bean espresso coconut vanilla carry palate plum chocolate astringent dry tannin abrupt finish

RevText.raw: Desiccated blackberry, leather, charred wood and mint aromas carry the nose on this full-bodied, tannic, heavily oaked Tinto Fino. Flavors of clove and woodspice sit on top of blackberry fruit, then hickory and other forceful oak-based aromas rise up and dominate the finish.
RevText.processed: desiccated blackberry leather charred wood mint aroma carry nose bodied tannic heavily oaked tinto fino flavor clove woodspice sit blackberry fruit hickory forceful oak base aroma rise dominate finish

RevText.raw: Delicate aromas recall white flower and citrus. The palate offers passion fruit, lime and white peach with a hint of mineral alongside bright acidity.
RevText.processed: delicate aroma recall white flower citrus palate offer passion fruit lime white peach hint mineral alongside bright acidity

RevText.raw: Clarksburg is becoming a haven for Chenin Blanc in California. This bottling, using fruit sourced from several vineyards in the area, is balanced with just a trace of sweetness in the background (1% residual sugar). This is crisp, straightforward and blessed with notes of pear and lime. Drink it cold.
RevText.processed: clarksburg haven chenin blanc california bottling use fruit source vineyard area balance trace sweetness background 1 residual sugar crisp straightforward bless note pear lime drink cold

RevText.raw: Savory dried thyme notes accent sunnier flavors of preserved peach in this brisk, off-dry wine. It's fruity and fresh, with an elegant, sprightly footprint.
RevText.processed: savory dry thyme note accent sunny flavor preserve peach brisk dry wine fruity fresh elegant sprightly footprint

RevText.raw: Ripe aromas of dark berries mingle with ample notes of black pepper, toasted vanilla and dusty tobacco. The palate is oak-driven in nature, but notes of tart red currant shine through, offering a bit of levity.
RevText.processed: ripe aroma dark berry mingle ample note black pepper toasted vanilla dusty tobacco palate oak drive nature note tart red currant shine offer bit levity

RevText.raw: Here's a bright, informal red that opens with aromas of candied berry, white pepper and savory herb that carry over to the palate. It's balanced with fresh acidity and soft tannins.
RevText.processed: bright informal red open aroma candy berry white pepper savory herb carry palate balanced fresh acidity soft tannin

RevText.raw: This is ripe and fruity, a wine that is smooth while still structured. Firm tannins are filled out with juicy red berry fruits and freshened with acidity. It's  already drinkable, although it will certainly be better from 2016.
RevText.processed: ripe fruity wine smooth structure firm tannin fill juicy red berry fruit freshen acidity drinkable certainly 2016

RevText.raw: Pineapple rind, lemon pith and orange blossom start off the aromas. The palate is a bit more opulent, with notes of honey-drizzled guava and mango giving way to a slightly astringent, semidry finish.
RevText.processed: pineapple rind lemon pith orange blossom start aroma palate bit opulent note honey drizzle guava mango way slightly astringent semidry finish

RevText.raw: Baked plum, molasses, balsamic vinegar and cheesy oak aromas feed into a palate that's braced by a bolt of acidity. A compact set of saucy red-berry and plum flavors features tobacco and peppery accents, while the finish is mildly green in flavor, with respectable weight and balance.
RevText.processed: baked plum molasse balsamic vinegar cheesy oak aroma feed palate brace bolt acidity compact set saucy red berry plum flavor feature tobacco peppery accent finish mildly green flavor respectable weight balance

RevText.raw: This wine from the Geneseo district offers aromas of sour plums and just enough cigar box to tempt the nose. The flavors are a bit flat at first, then the acidity and tension of sour cherries emerges in the midpalate, bolstered by some black licorice.
RevText.processed: wine geneseo district offer aroma sour plum cigar box tempt nose flavor bit flat acidity tension sour cherry emerge midpalate bolster black licorice

RevText.raw: Aromas of prune, blackcurrant, toast and oak carry through to the extracted palate, along with flavors of black cherry and roasted coffee beans. Firm but drying tannins provide the framework.
RevText.processed: aroma prune blackcurrant toast oak carry extract palate flavor black cherry roasted coffee bean firm drying tannin provide framework

RevText.raw: Oak and earth intermingle around robust aromas of wet forest floor in this vineyard-designated Pinot that hails from a high-elevation site. Small in production, it offers intense, full-bodied raspberry and blackberry steeped in smoky spice and smooth texture.
RevText.processed: oak earth intermingle robust aroma wet forest floor vineyard designate pinot hail high elevation site small production offer intense bodied raspberry blackberry steep smoky spice smooth texture

RevText.raw: Zesty orange peels and apple notes abound in this sprightly, mineral-toned Riesling. Off dry on the palate, yet racy and lean, it's a refreshing, easy quaffer with wide appeal.
RevText.processed: zesty orange peel apple note abound sprightly mineral tone riesling dry palate racy lean refreshing easy quaffer wide appeal

RevText.raw: This is a dry wine, very spicy, with a tight, taut texture and strongly mineral character layered with citrus as well as pepper. It's a food wine with its almost crisp aftertaste.
RevText.processed: dry wine spicy tight taut texture strongly mineral character layer citrus pepper food wine crisp aftertaste

RevText.raw: Soft, supple plum envelopes an oaky structure in this Cabernet, supported by 15% Merlot. Coffee and chocolate complete the picture, finishing strong at the end, resulting in a value-priced wine of attractive flavor and immediate accessibility.
RevText.processed: soft supple plum envelope oaky structure cabernet support 15 merlot coffee chocolate complete picture finish strong end result value price wine attractive flavor immediate accessibility

RevText.raw: Pretty aromas of yellow flower and stone fruit lead the nose. The bright palate offers yellow apple, apricot, vanilla and delicate notes of lightly toasted oak alongside crisp acidity.
RevText.processed: pretty aroma yellow flower stone fruit lead nose bright palate offer yellow apple apricot vanilla delicate note lightly toast oak alongside crisp acidity

RevText.raw: Aromas recall ripe dark berry, toast and a whiff of cake spice. The soft, informal palate offers sour cherry, vanilla and a hint of espresso alongside round tannins. Drink soon.
RevText.processed: aroma recall ripe dark berry toast whiff cake spice soft informal palate offer sour cherry vanilla hint espresso alongside round tannin drink soon

RevText.raw: This has great depth of flavor with its fresh apple and pear fruits and touch of spice. It's off dry while balanced with acidity and a crisp texture. Drink now.
RevText.processed: great depth flavor fresh apple pear fruit touch spice dry balance acidity crisp texture drink

RevText.raw: Much like the regular bottling from 2012, this comes across as rather rough and tannic, with rustic, earthy, herbal characteristics. Nonetheless, if you think of it as a pleasantly unfussy country wine, it's a good companion to a hearty winter stew.
RevText.processed: like regular bottling 2012 come rough tannic rustic earthy herbal characteristic nonetheless think pleasantly unfussy country wine good companion hearty winter stew

RevText.raw: Tart and snappy, the flavors of lime flesh and rind dominate. Some green pineapple pokes through, with crisp acidity underscoring the flavors. The wine was all stainless-steel fermented.
RevText.processed: tart snappy flavor lime flesh rind dominate green pineapple poke crisp acidity underscore flavor wine stainless steel ferment

RevText.raw: Aromas suggest mature berry, scorched earth, animal, toast and anise. The palate offers ripe black berry, oak, espresso, cocoa and vanilla alongside dusty tannins.
RevText.processed: aroma suggest mature berry scorch earth animal toast anise palate offer ripe black berry oak espresso cocoa vanilla alongside dusty tannin

RevText.raw: Blackberry and raspberry aromas show a typical Navarran whiff of green herbs and, in this case, horseradish. In the mouth, this is fairly full bodied, with tomatoey acidity. Spicy, herbal flavors complement dark plum fruit, while the finish is fresh but grabby.
RevText.processed: blackberry raspberry aroma typical navarran whiff green herb case horseradish mouth fairly bodied tomatoey acidity spicy herbal flavor complement dark plum fruit finish fresh grabby
